intro: Eunanus nanus, commonly known as the dwarf eunanus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, featuring compact foliage and delicate, small flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eunanus nanus is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
